question.questionA: Annuals, glandular pubescent above; cauline leaves present.
question.questionB: Annuals or perennial; leaves all radical.

question.questionA: Leaves ovate, less than three times as long as broad.
question.questionB: Leaves linear-lanceolate, more than three times as long as broad.

question.questionA: Leaves linear-lanceolate, more than three times as long as broad.
question.questionB: Leaves neither silver-haired nor with sinuous margins.

question.questionA: Annuals; leaves hairy, bright green; stem scarcely exceeding the leaves; spike ovoid; bracts and calyx lobes acute; corolla white.
question.questionB: Annuals or perennials; stem greatly exceeding the leaves; coroll yellowish or brownish.

question.questionA: Flowering stem grooved or ribbed; leaves without teeth.
question.questionB: Flowering stem smooth, neither grooved nor ribbed; leaves dentate.

question.questionA: Annuals, 10-30 cm; leaves lanceolate, narrowed to a short petiole, three- to five-veined; inflorescence covered in long white, silky hairs; bracts and calyx densely hairy; corolla lobes hairy on the back, corolla tube glabrous.
question.questionB: Perennials, 5-70 cm; leaves lanceolate, narrowed to a long petiole, three- to seven-veined; inflorescence not covered in long white silky hairs; bracts glabrous or shortly hairy, ovate with long scarious tips; corolla brownish, with a prominent brown mid-vein running to the tip of each lobe; stamens white.

question.questionA: Leaves fleshy, bright green, simply dentate; stems more or less glabrous; bracts subtending inflorescence acute, those subtending the flowers, short, rounded; flowers brownish; corolla glabrous.
question.questionB: Leaves not fleshy, often glaucous, deeply divided into dentate oblong segments,  rarely  entire; stems hairy; bracts ovate, usually with long scarious point; flowers yellowish; corolla tube hairy.
